messages.content: As an AI assistant, my role is to meticulously analyze criminal justice documents and extract information about law enforcement personnel. The response will contain: 1) The name of a law enforcement personnel. The individual's name must be prefixed with one of the following titles to be in law enforcement: Detective, Sergeant, Lieutenant, Captain, Deputy, Officer, Patrol Officer, Criminalist, Technician, Coroner, or Dr. Please prefix the name with 'Officer Name: I will derive this data from the following paragraph: CASE NAME: The Cryptic Castle Conundrum DATE: 04/04/64 The courtroom was imbued with a mix of anticipation and anxiety as the trial progressed. The prosecution called upon the officers key to the investigation to elucidate on their findings. LAW ENFORCEMENT TESTIMONY: PROSECUTOR: Please state your name and role in the investigation. WITNESS: I am Lieutenant A. B. Carter, the chief investigator in this case. PROSECUTOR: Thank you, Lieutenant Carter. Could you recount the events on the evening the conundrum was discovered? WITNESS: Certainly. On the evening of October 10th, Officer C. D. Davis noticed a broken window in the castle and reported it. The investigation was launched immediately. PROSECUTOR: Who took charge of the forensic examination? WITNESS: Sergeant E. F. Evans and Technician G. H. Ford carried out the forensic analysis. PROSECUTOR: Who undertook the interrogations? WITNESS: Detectives I. J. Graham and K. L. Harris handled the interrogations of suspects and potential witnesses. PROSECUTOR: Thank you. No further questions. The Defense initiated a cross-examination of Lieutenant Carter concerning the investigative methodologies. During the trial, Patrol Officers M. N. Isaac, O. P. Jackson, and Q. R. Kelly were also called to the stand.
Identify each individual in the transcript, by name, who are directly referred to as officers, sergeants, lieutenants, captains, detectives, homicide officers, and crime lab personnel.

Officer Name: Lieutenant A. B. Carter 
Officer Context: Lieutenant Carter is the chief investigator in the Cryptic Castle Conundrum case, describing the events on the evening the conundrum was discovered during the trial. 
Officer Role: Lieutenant 

Officer Name: Officer C. D. Davis 
Officer Context: Officer Davis observed a broken window in the castle on the evening of October 10th, which initiated the investigation. 
Officer Role: Officer 

Officer Name: Sergeant E. F. Evans 
Officer Context: Sergeant Evans, alongside Technician G. H. Ford, was responsible for carrying out the forensic examination related to the case. 
Officer Role: Sergeant 

Officer Name: Technician G. H. Ford 
Officer Context: Technician Ford worked with Sergeant E. F. Evans on the forensic analysis concerning the broken window at the castle. 
Officer Role: Technician 

Officer Name: Detective I. J. Graham 
Officer Context: Detective Graham, alongside Detective K. L. Harris, conducted interrogations of suspects and potential witnesses to gather more information regarding the conundrum. 
Officer Role: Detective 

Officer Name: Detective K. L. Harris 
Officer Context: Detective Harris, along with Detective I. J. Graham, was tasked with interrogating individuals to collect additional information about the incident. 
Officer Role: Detective 

Officer Name: Patrol Officers M. N. Isaac, O. P. Jackson, and Q. R. Kelly 
Officer Context: These Patrol Officers were summoned to testify during the trial, although their specific roles in the investigation were not detailed in the transcript. 
Officer Role: Patrol Officers
